page.title: 08Launds Farm
page.content: _Around 1900 Launds Farm house burned down and rebuilt a few yards away form orignal site. Te farm manager at the time was Mr Griffiths and fire started in the cart shed. Today we call this the Granary. The name Launds as we spell it was spelt Lawns and Lawnds. The biggest change to the farm is roadway in, when Mr Cliff took over the farm in 1937 the road came through Ivy Farm and was straight but very steep. if it rained a horse and cart coudnt get out again and so the roadway was made as it is today but still only a dirt track but had two bends and not quite as steep. nowadays the road is tarmac.All the fields at Launds fArm are still called by the original names, such as Five Days Wrok, Shoulder of Mutton, Far Ox Close, Newland and many more.
